content:
If We shall consent to a transfer of interest in this Policy, the period during which the interest was in the Transferor shall not accrue to the benefit of the Transferee.

You cannot transfer the No Claim Discount (NCD) to anyone else.

No Claim Discount (NCD) shall be reduced if one or more claims have been made during a Period of Insurance as follows:

**NCD Table 2**
* With a current NCD of 50%, the reduced NCD is 20% if one claim is made, and 0% if two or more claims are made.
* With a current NCD of 40%, the reduced NCD is 10% if one claim is made, and 0% if two or more claims are made.
* With a current NCD of 10% to 30%, the reduced NCD is 0% if one claim is made, and 0% if two or more claims are made.
questions: What happens to the No Claim Discount if I make one claim during the insurance period?
Can the No Claim Discount be transferred to another person?
What is the effect on the NCD if two or more claims are made during the insurance period?

What are the consequences of transferring interest in the insurance policy?
What happens to the NCD if it was initially between 10% and 30% and I make a claim?
Is there any reduction in NCD for claims when the initial NCD is 40%?
Does the period of interest under the previous owner count towards the new owner after a policy transfer?
What is the new NCD percentage if I start with a 40% NCD and make one claim?
How many claims need to be made to reduce a 50% NCD to 0%?
